2170087242,pull_request,closed,,Add boolean wrapper functions for perm checks,Adds the following functions:

These are essentially wrappers for the existing permission check functions (like `table-permission-for-user`), but they take a permission value as an additional argument and return a Boolean indicating whether the user has at least that level of permissions. These should hopefully be a bit clearer and easier to use when doing permission checks. I've left the old functions as they are, since there are a few spots that still need to fetch the actual perm value for the user as a keyword.",noahmoss,2024-03-05 20:24:49+00:00,['noahmoss'],2024-03-07 15:15:18+00:00,2024-03-05 21:03:19+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39653,"[('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 1979579370, 'issue_id': 2170087242, 'author': 'noahmoss', 'body': '* **#39653** üëà * **#37473** : 26 other dependent PRs ([#37191](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37191) , [#37377](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37377) , [#37379](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37379) and 23 others) * `master` This stack of pull requests is managed by Graphite. This PR is the backend implementation of ""smaller fix"" described in [this issue comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/12496#issuecomment-1629317661).

`expression-parts` are used on FE to set filter picker for filter expression. Filter expressions that check equality of column with `:temporal-unit` set to value other than `:minute` or `:day` were handled incorrectly. Eg. `[:= {...} [:field {:temporal-unit :week} 111] ""2024-05-12""]` would make FE use filter picker set to _on_ even though this equality effectively describes interval. Current filter picker implementation does not support that.
To overcome that, this PR expands the expressions that would require range to be rendered correctly in current filter picker to use `:between` instead of `:=`.

2170023368,pull_request,closed,,Scroll dashboard tabs to the end when adding a tab,Fixes #38641

When adding a new tab to a dashboard with many tabs, the new tab and the ""new tab"" button can get covered by the ""scroll to the right"" button. Now we'll be scrolling to the right automatically once a new tab is added; also makes the transition instant.

- Optimize MLv2 calls. Defer as much as possible.
- Remove effects and any async logic.

- Split `JoinStep` into `Join` and `JoinDraft`. Draft version is used for incomplete joins (without the table / left-hand-side / right-hand-side column). Draft joins have different state, and all updates are done differently. **It should be much cleaner and easier to follow than before**. If in doubt, compare with `use-join`, `use-join-condition` and `JoinStep` from `master`. Because of the simplification I could do MLv2 calls in an optional way for each case - complete or draft join/condition.
I'd recommend reviewing from `JoinStep`. In files that are changed heavily the diff is irrelevant.
- Add a question with a join
- Open the column picker for the joined table
- Tick or untick or a column
Currently there are 2 rerenders, however the notebook is re-rendered indeed once.

2169367942,pull_request,closed,,Specify GH project board per team,### Description

Previously we all used a single board https://github.com/orgs/metabase/projects/50/views/1 but not only two team use it. In order not to pollute their board with PRs from other teams, now every team will specify their own board if needed.
Example run where it did not add this PR to the board: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8160443973/job/22307033268

2167835242,pull_request,closed,,Fail number parsing if it is only a substring,"Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38956
This fixes an issue where we would silently coerce date strings to integers when parsing them as such.
This change should fix this relaxed coercion for any non-number that incidentally starts with something numeric.
1. Upload a CSV with an integer column
2. Append a CSV with a date in the same column
Previously the append would have succeeded, by treating the first chunk of the date (e.g. day) as the value.

With this change the upload will fail due to type incompatibility.",crisptrutski,2024-03-04 21:50:07+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2024-03-06 13:52:58+00:00,2024-03-06 13:52:57+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39576,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1977544509, 'issue_id': 2167835242, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2167682942,pull_request,closed,,ChartSettingOrderedItems using SortableList,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38293

As part of the push to prep for a react upgrade, and generally consolidate DnD libraries, this PR removes the dependency of `react-sortable-hoc` in `ChartSettingOrderedItems`, instead using the `SortableList` component. No changes should be obvious to end users
1. Go to a table visualization and re-order columns and hide/show. Should behave as normal
2. Go to a multi series visualization (orders, count grouped by created at: year, product -> category). You should be able to order / show / hide the series as expected
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2167619854,pull_request,closed,,Fix use of perms API when populating :native_permissions on databases,Here's another spot where `database-permission-for-user` was being used as if it returns a boolean, when it really returns a keyword representing the user's permission level. This was caught by an e2e test added recently in `master`. This should make the perms refactor feature branch green again.

This raises the question of if we should change the API (or add new APIs) to take a perm type _and_ value and return a Boolean? I'm concerned that it's hard to catch if this API is used incorrectly since keywords are valid truthy values. 2167275782,pull_request,closed,,Fix query builder query string parsing,**Problem:** The query string parser for the query builder is accidentally including the `?` after parsing the query string. It should be removing that character (using `.slice(1)` not `.slice(0)`), so that it can correctly parse the query parameters without the prepended `?`

You can see the URL flickers with a `%3F` included after the `?`. `%3F` is a character encoding for `?`. i.e. Because we are including the `?` after parsing, the first parameter in the query string will have that character prepended.

The only reason we see it go back to normal is because `SyncedParametersList` receives the new parameter value (independent of the URL) and then updates the URL to reflect the current parameter state ([use-synced-list-query.ts](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/frontend/src/metabase/hooks/use-synced-query-string.ts#L6))

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Open a dashboard, navigate to a question by clicking on a card title. Back button should be round.
2. Try to create a new model. Cards should have background and shadow.

2167142906,pull_request,closed,,[MLv2] `joinable-columns` on a Join sets source and alias,`(joinable-columns query stage a-join)` previously returned

columns with the same shape as from `visible-columns`.
Also refactors a series of `mapv` transforms into a transducer pipeline.

1. If there is no default value and user used some value on the dashboard, we need to restore this value when user gets back to the dashboard, no matter how user opens a dashboard (with a direct URL, after a search)
2. values are preserved per user per dashboard, we decided to use localStorage for it and if the idea works, we can involve BE to store those values on BE.
3. User needs to use the same machine and browser session to get benefits from this feature, preserving does not work if user switches machine and/or browser
4. Tests are red by intention. After the initial feedback from product and design they will be fixed
- Go to any dashboard with filters
- either remove URL search parameters (after `?`) or go to the root collection
- then find your dashboard and with filters and make sure that
b. query for the mapped questions includes preserved parameter value into account
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2165570521,pull_request,closed,,Postgres: Sync table row count,Milestone 1 of : https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229, part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39176
This epic is about introducing a new fingerprint process that will do a full table scan on the table `select count(distinct(name)) from table` for example.

2165371349,pull_request,closed,,Convert column to float when appending floats to an integer column,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37069
This adds a type detection step during append which checks for columns that would need to be relaxed, and does so if we've configured that transition as OK.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Upload a CSV with an all integer column as a new table.
2. View the table and confirm it has integer type.
3. Append a CSV with the same column containing floats to the same table.
4. View the table and confirm it has a float type, and numbers were not truncated.

2165227509,pull_request,closed,,Use toposort to simplify and fix CSV column type operations,### Description
This PR replaces the breadth first search, which gave an ""unintuitive""[^1] ordering, with a topological sorting.
Given this stronger foundation, we can then replace the hard coded parsing order with a graph traversal.
This also implicitly corrects a benign defect where `::date` and `::datetime` were out of order in value type inference.

[^1]: When traversing the ancestors of `::boolean-or-int`, we would reach `::varchar-255` before `::float`.",crisptrutski,2024-03-03 07:24:54+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2024-03-07 23:52:29+00:00,2024-03-05 14:01:10+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39491,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1975072140, 'issue_id': 2165227509, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': '* **#39493** : 5 dependent PRs ([#39706](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39706) , [#39724](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39724) , [#39741](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39741) and 2 others) * **#39491** üëà * `master` This stack of pull requests is managed by Graphite. crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-03-04 17:17:35 UTC): I think I was mistaken about this being a bug in practice.

We mitigate the ""mistake"" in the ordering by having a different ""attempt to parse"" function (`parse-local-datetime`) and actual parser (`parse-as-datetime`). The latter respects the hierarchy - I missed that detail at first.

calherries on (2024-03-04 18:19:32 UTC): As discussed on zoom:
- let's make the preference for non-concrete types explicit, not using parent order
- ordered-hierarchy is cool for understanding/deterministic behaviour, so lets leave that as is
- add a docstring to `upload/h` to saying the main reason we use ordered-hierarchy is to get topologically sorted ancestors

A native query that produces ambiguous columns `select id, id from orders` cannot be wrapped to reference those columns without disambiguation: `select source.id from (select id, id from orders) as source` fails. In SQL 92 support for table column aliases was added `select source.id from (select id, id from orders) as source (id, id_2)` but many drivers still do not support this including mariadb, sqlite, bigquery

However, `with` statements are widely supported and can rename columns as needed too. I was surprised that nesting with statements was so well supported but it appears that all of our drivers handle it well.",snoe,2024-03-01 20:06:12+00:00,['snoe'],2024-03-15 17:45:25+00:00,2024-03-15 17:45:12+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39476,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]","[{'comment_id': 1973854966, 'issue_id': 2164092001, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2164041550,pull_request,closed,,Fix errors happening after canceling a new dashboard tab creation,Fixes #38278, fixes #38055

We didn't reset `state.dashboard.selectedTabId` when canceling dashboard editing. As a result, if we added a new tab and canceled the edits, we'd have `selectedTabId` pointing to a tab that doesn't exist, causing different problems.
1. New > Dashboad > Add a card and save
2. Start editing > Add a new tab > Cancel editing
3. Ensure you're back to the 1st tab with your card on it
4. Start editing > Add a new card > Save

5. Ensure the save was successful and the changes are persisted",kulyk,2024-03-01 19:28:32+00:00,['kulyk'],2024-03-05 18:44:21+00:00,2024-03-05 18:44:09+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39473,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]","[{'comment_id': 1973804866, 'issue_id': 2164041550, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2164036294,pull_request,closed,,Replace `dashboard.isEditing` state with `dashboard.editingDashboard`,`isEditing` sounds like a boolean edit mode indicator, but it has a `Dashboard

Add an hostname support to snowflake. When set, it will be used instead of `<account_name>.snowflakecomputing.com`
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Have a snowflake instance not accessible directly on *.snowflakecomputing.com
2. When adding the Snowflake connection, select `Use hostname` and set an hostname.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2163746159,pull_request,closed,,Differentiate `UserSettings` type from the rest of the `Settings`,### Description
This PR introduces a new type called `UserSettings` to differentiate it from the rest of the `Settings`.
It also brings type safety to the `updateUserSetting` action.
Try passing a wrong key or a wrong value to the `updateUserSetting` action. TS should complain.

2163723910,pull_request,closed,,Native query default parameter values: use ParameterValuePicker for single strings, numbers, and dates","Part of [[Epic] Better UI/UX for picking default parameter values](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39211)
We start from updating Default value picker in Native queries.
- üêû fixes: when we reset widget type (think `date/relative` -> `date/single`), reset the default value too
- üêû fixes ugly year picker lacking gap with the quarter selector in Quarter and Year picker
- disables Filter widget type when it has a single value (ID or None)
- uses Mantine for a single number (when you selected Number) or string (String + Input box)
- uses Mantine for date picker popovers
- stops using moment for generating ISO-style dates 2024-03-06
Instead of changing the original `ParameterValueWidget`, I have built a `ParameterValuePicker` component which reuses the former internally.
tag, parameter -> ParameterValuePicker -> can I render it? ---YES--> do it
- precisely control what is rendered by the new component (it defaults to `false`)
- selectively roll out the change by choosing which components use `ParameterValuePicker`
- in case something breaks, easily revert the changes
- once we're done with Native queries, reuse the component for Dashboard parameters

I deliberately made the component sub-tree (until it reaches `Date*` widgets) stateless. This way we don't struggle with the mismatch between the internal component state and what's coming to it from the store.
This was previously controlled by `commitImmediately` but as of this PR, I don't see why we would need internal state, which makes internals more complicated.
- we still need to transition to Mantine and match UIs
- there are multiple bugs and inadequacies in the current default value picking flow

2162923673,pull_request,closed,,Optimize some parts of Notebook editor,### Description

This PR addresses several perf problems, hovewer other problems seems cannot be addressed because of a nature of cljs and data immutability together with probably missing methods and some perf problems in cljs code.

1. `NotebookSteps` component tracks in his state a list of opened steps - steps which user added compared to the saved state or all steps for a new question. There was added a premature optimization to close an opened step on query change, but we didn't track was the step opened and not and with MLv2 we get a new query instance in many cases (e.g. when some specific column is selected/unselected in the join step). So even if no steps were opened, we updated a state of `NotebookSteps` component and triggered re-rendering of all children components down by the tree.
üîß Check if the step is opened, and do not update state if it's not
2. `TimeSeriesChrome` component is not shown in Notebook mode, but it performs calculations under the hood.
üîß Do not render `TimeSeriesChrome` component in Notebook mode
3. `ViewTitleHeaderRightSide` components triggers `question.canRun()` method, which is extremely expensive for some reason, twice for the same question.
üîß trigger `question.canRun()` once and reuse the result
### What can't be updated, but it would help

- `JoinStep` is re-rendered because of results of `Lib.joinStrategy(join)` and `Lib.joinConditions(join)`. As query reference is new every time, joinStrategy and joinConditions return a new reference every time causing re-rendering of the component
- `JoinCondition` is re-rendered because of JoinStep and `Lib.joinConditionParts`, which returns new references for `lhsColumn` and `rhsColumn`
play with QB with multiple steps (especially several join steps)
All tests were done on the same question and with CPU throttling emulation x6, performing one click on the dropdown

To do so, using Chrome DevTools Protocol or any other tool:
- prepare a dashboard data in the following format https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39433/files#diff-886ddd0262eff9162d1b97de078de831d853d514fc4acc041859769f2e040e3d and serialize it as JSON
- evaluate a script `window.render(""*your_JSON*"")` on the page

[Codenotify](https://github.com/sourcegraph/codenotify): Notifying subscribers in CODENOTIFY files for diff e12151b44a3d7c5136d48622277c1e7539b44a4e...a950c330dabb4e221a6312509c8af719f02c8110.

After merging #39251, I realized that there are two more user-local settings that are still using the `updateSetting` instead of our fresh new `updateUserSetting`. This means that updating these settings would result in trying to fetch all settings, which leads to `403`
1. As a non-admin user, go to `browse/models`
3. Make sure that no `GET /api/setting` happens in the network tab
1. As an admin enable and set the custom homepage using any of the existing dashboards
2. As a non-admin, go to the home page
3. Dismiss the toast that says ""Your admin has set this dashboard as your homepage""
4. Make sure that no `GET /api/setting` happens in the network tab
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

I can add E2E tests for this to the existing https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/e2e/test/scenarios/permissions/reproductions/39221-fetch-settings-only-if-admin.cy.spec.js but it feels like an overkill. Adding types in #39223 should be enough, IMO.
I'll have to create a manual backport that combines #39251 and this PR.

2161791021,pull_request,closed,,Fix click behavior when routing to a different tab on the same dashboard,- Closes: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38455
### How to Manually Verify the Solution
1. Create a dashboard with two tabs
2. Put a card on each of the tabs
3. Create a filter that is attached to a card on both of the tabs
4. Configure click behavior on the card on the first tab to route to the 2nd tab on this same dashboard
5. Save and check that clicking routes you to the 2nd tab

2161757762,pull_request,closed,,Hack test case to unblock Oracle tests,In metabase.query-processor-test.implicit-joins-test/implicit-joins-with-expressions-test we calculate an interval by going back from today a number of years to arrive at 2019. On February 29, this calculation fails with Oracle because there was no February 29 in 2019. This hack changes 2019 to 2020 and makes Oracle happy.

The real fix would be to make sure such calculations don't fail with Oracle.",metamben,2024-02-29 17:26:06+00:00,['metamben'],2024-02-29 19:49:26+00:00,2024-02-29 19:49:12+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39317,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]","[{'comment_id': 1971847241, 'issue_id': 2161757762, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@metamben Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 29, 19, 49, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]","github-actions[bot] on (2024-02-29 19:49:26 UTC): @metamben Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_

2161647939,pull_request,closed,,Forcefully reload table/card metadata when there are no fields (yet),"Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37009
Create a native query model on PG with:
SELECT PG_SLEEP(20) as A, 1 as B
Try to create a saved based on this model. There would be no fields in Data selector.
Keep trying to select this model in data picker. Eventually you would get fields and will stop sending extra requests.

Please note that with this approach there are some duplicate requests happening for such tables without metadata, but hopefully that's acceptable here.",ranquild,2024-02-29 16:29:54+00:00,['ranquild'],2024-03-04 11:03:57+00:00,2024-03-01 16:03:57+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39311,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 1971533323, 'issue_id': 2161647939, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2161183773,pull_request,closed,,[WIP] Disable saving native questions and models without result_metadata,Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37009

You're now required to run the native query before saving the question/model. Native questions without `result_metadata` are useless. Currently we try to workaround this issue by re-running the native query after some time, but that turned out to be error-prone.

Tests will be added later, when BE is ready: #39291
3 e2e test suites are failing, but it's because of target PR (#39162).
#### Not everything is ready in the backend
- the extraction drill is shown for table cells (should be shown only for table headers)
- the order of extraction types is reversed (should go from ""Hour of day"" to ""Year"")
- using extraction twice will result in duplicated column name error
- year is incorrectly formatted (should be `2025` not, `2,025`)
- months should be shown as names, not numbers
- quarters should be shown as Q1, Q2 etc., not numbers
- ""Day"" should be called ""Day of the month""
- ""Hour of day"" and ""Day of week"" extractions are missing

> If you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details.

> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.
Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

Updates the setup process to call POST /api/setup after the language and user details step is completed then proceeds to make every step after completely atomic. This helps reduce the time the instance spends using the setup token as an auth strategy and tightens security. Consequently, we can no longer need to rely on some of the other setup endpoints as we already have endpoints for fully authenticated users (which the user becomes after they submit their details).
- There's been some UX changes required to make this feature more modular / easier to ship. Since the main setup endpoint can only be called once, we can't allow users
to go back to the first two steps.

- The other downside to this new approach is we have no ""abandoned cart"" functionality if the user doesn't complete the setup after the user details step. They will have provided as much information as needed to initialize their instance, so all further data will have to be collected from within the application.
### Summary of the list of updates make to FE/BE:
- make first two steps of setup flow an atomic step
- reduces setup options accepted by POST /api/setup
- removes POST /api/setup/validate endpoint to validate a db connection
- updates POST /api/database/validate endpoint to result with same response schema as POST /api/setup/validate did (preserves existing data as well)
- FE relies on settings endpoints for things like allowing/disallowing tracking, saving license token, etc.
- removes POST /api/setup/token-check as we can rely on a 400 response to detect validity
- Setup a new instance and test that setup flow is functionally identical to existing behaviors (except the aforementioned no going back)
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2160108360,pull_request,closed,,Fixing E2E Cross-version Tests,E2E cross version tests were broken for multiple reasons, primarily due to changes made in UI layout, cypress testing, and data changes. Overall, the basic workflows still work, but subtle click order differences and other small changes made the entire job consistently fail.

- Provides a function, `parseVersionString`, which computes version information provided a test version string. This information includes the raw string version, the edition (ee or oss), and the major, minor, and patch version of the version string.
- In the same file, `cross-version-helpers.js`, adds constants identifying versions in which certain breaking UI or Cypress changes occurred.
- Finally, a set of exported functions are provided which take a version object and execute conditional logic based on the provided version so that behavior is consistent across Metabase versions.
The versions are computed in `cross-version-source-helpers.js` and `cross-version-target-helpers.js` and are used in js files as shown:
This then allows logic like the below, where the high level call is made and the right logic is dispatched based on the version information.
Other smaller changes were also made that created a more universal sequence of UI actions.

2159865712,pull_request,closed,,Don't delete ""off"" persisted_info records","If they are off, they are ""eligible"" models for persistence that we do not want to persist. And to remember that use choice to not persist them we need to keep the record around. This was handled previously, but https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39219 was a bit too blunt. We had a bunch of records in a ""creating"" state that we weren't removing, so i deleted them regardless of state. But we want to make sure that the ""off"" ones are not deleted.
On stats, a bunch of ones that were set to off are now slated to be persisted after the prune job deleted the persisted_info records.

2159839228,pull_request,closed,,Do not return value if the database id used for `last-used-native-database-id` does not exist (anymore),This PR is a follow up after #38986.
It is quite possible that a user persists a database (id), and that this database gets deleted afterwards.

Even though the frontend handles this pretty well (which is confirmed by the existing E2E test), we wanted to follow up with a custom `:getter` for this particular setting that would return `nil` if the persisted database doesn't exist anymore.
This PR tries to achieve exactly that.
It updates and expands the previously written backend unit tests to reflect this new condition.
At the very minimum, all tests should pass.
1.  Send a `PUT /api/setting/last-used-native-database-id`. For the `value` use a database id value that doesn't exist (e.g. 999)
2.  Call `GET /api/session/properties` and make sure that `last-used-native-database-id` is `null`
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2159822890,pull_request,closed,,Dashboard Header FC, using entity, select, and dispatch hooks","Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39260

Migrating the Dashboard Header to be a functional component, leveraging entity hooks, as well as removing Redux Connect. This is largely done as we may have a need to use hooks in this component as part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39259 . The experience should not change for the end user (save for a loading state while fetching the collection, which may be _slightly_ different).
Existing tests should cover this component and the functionality inside it

Invalid expressions are dropped by MLv2, before migration invalid expressions weren't dropped, but they couldn't be executed anyway, so this PR uses `diagnoseExpression` method from MLv2 to detect invalid expressions.
Currently, it's not possible to highlight the exact place with an error and get user-friendly error message from MLv2, so we use a generic message `Invalid expression`.
follow steps from the changed e2e test
- Create a new question using the Sample Database > Orders table
- Add a custom column `case(isempty([Discount]), ""true"", ""false"")` called ""discount is empty""
- Done button should be disabled and you should see a message ""invalid expression""
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2159192806,pull_request,closed,,Do not fetch app settings when updating user-local setting,### Description

As explained in the [original issue](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39221), we have two types of settings. App, or site, settings are accessible only by admins. OTOH, there are user-local settings that should be accessible to non-admins.
- Updating any setting (app or user) would result in fetching all settings
- Updating admin settings results in fetching all settings (we're not changing this)
- Updating a user-local setting results in fetching only settings available to all users (we get these from `/api/session/properties` endpoint)
- Start a new native query or a new native model
- Make sure there is no `GET /api/setting` call in your browser's network tab (previously resulted in `403`)
Simply run a provided E2E reproduction.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

Fixes #39221.",nemanjaglumac,2024-02-28 15:09:29+00:00,['nemanjaglumac'],2024-02-29 17:50:46+00:00,2024-02-29 16:18:06+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39251,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 1969216296, 'issue_id': 2159192806, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

cleanup of `composes` usage, in some cases it makes sense to reuse repeatable styles, in other it looks more like a home-brewed tailwind. Dropping unneeded composes opens a way to clean up unused styles
click through the app - it should look nice, as before, nothing should change

2157342705,pull_request,closed,,Delete all pruned persisted info records,We prune persisted info records if they meet any of the following criteria:
But we only deleted the record when:

So any records that were in a ""creating"" state (persist a model, but before it first gets persisted, make it not a model, or archive the underlying model), we constantly pruned them but never removed the persisted info record.

Because 21 things were queued up for pruning, were attempted to be pruned, but the persisted info record never removed. And so we ""remove"" 21 persisted_info records every hour. But we actually aren't doing anything.
If the test looks a little weird it is to get output like:
We delete persisted_info records for all of the pruned

2157243218,pull_request,closed,,use onRenderError callback to handle chart rendering errors,### Description
Unifies how rendering errors inside visualizations are handled by calling `props.onRenderError`
Add `throw new Error('foo')` to `getCartesianChartOption` function and ensure it shows an error message.

The error message is `Error: A cross-origin error was thrown. React doesn't have access to the actual error object in development` ~because of missing CORS setup on the Clojure side which will be added further.~
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2157016168,pull_request,closed,,[Feature branch] Split data access and query builder access,Migration to populate new `view-data` and `make-queries` permissions based on existing data perms in the `data_permissions` table. Also includes rollback migrations.

The SQL migrations are a bit gnarly but they should match the mappings from these tables: https://www.notion.so/metabase/Split-data-access-and-query-builder-access-merge-GUI-and-SQL-f18185f2c2954127bdfcb2864ef5c13f?pvs=4#810abbe9bf7f45bd8074f69736d75f5c

column1: [Codenotify](https://github.com/sourcegraph/codenotify): Notifying subscribers in CODENOTIFY files for diff def9a9afac5bab66c8e0059fa59a02d5e9600576...9b82f0648d8ed124c983ffc2828d9af07a8a4222.
Adds an error boundary to catch errors while rendering `CartesianChart`.

My original approach was to call `props.onRenderError` within the error boundary's `componentDidCatch` method, but for some reason it would not actually display the error message in in the `ErrorView` component that's used by `Visualization`, so I opted just to render `ErrorView` directly in the boundary instead.
_Not sure how to test it in a prod environment_

2155298796,pull_request,closed,,Keep result-metadata of native queries if possible,Part of #37009.

The problem this PR is fixing is that for native queries the before update hook of the card doesn't populate `result_metadata`, but sets it to `nil` instead (to make sure we have no stale metadata, which we consider worse than no metadata at all). When a native question is updated and the result metadata doesn't change, the `t2/changes` function omits `result_metadata` and the above behavior is triggered.

To solve the problem, when a question is updated via the API and we are able to determine the result metadata, we set a flag that forces the use of that metadata (which might mean that the field is left untouched, if there's no change).

This PR doesn't fully solve the problem, because we only set the result metadata if the query finishes in 1.5 s. In other cases, the behavior is unchanged, and the FE will get `nil` as metadata.",metamben,2024-02-26 22:40:45+00:00,['metamben'],2024-02-27 15:30:47+00:00,2024-02-27 15:30:35+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39184,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]","[{'comment_id': 1965473418, 'issue_id': 2155298796, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2155194359,pull_request,closed,,fix incorrect tooltip value in pie chart,"Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33342

For pie chart tooltips, we were incorrectly using the `.value` property of the pie chart slice. We can't use this because it is modified one case to make slices smaller than the minimum percentage setting look bigger.
// increase ""other"" slice so it's barely visible
Instead, we should be using `slice.displayValue`, as was intended
// Value is used to determine arc size and is modified for very small
// other slices. We save displayValue for use in tooltips.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2154840544,pull_request,closed,,DB prevents creating new data permission paths,We previously had code preventing new data permission paths from being created, but this adds a DB constraint that has the same effect.

Why is this necessary? Imagine we did not have this change in placea, and we have a clustered environment with rolling upgrades. Server A and Server B both start out running v49, and then an upgrade to v50 is triggered.
At the beginning of the upgrade, all data is being read from/written to the Permissions table.
Server A is restarted first, and starts in v50. It begins the migration, copying data permissions from Permissions into DataPermissions.

However, during this process, Server B may accept requests to alter data permissions. Because it's still running v49 code, it will write those changes to the Permissions table and tell the user the change was successful.
But when the rolling upgrade is complete, Server B's changes to the Permissions table will be orphaned - nothing will read them.

With this change, we'll prohibit writing new data permissions paths to the Permissions table at the beginning of the migration process. This way, Server B will respond with errors to any attempt to change data permissions until it's upgraded and the migration is complete.

EDIT: I also ended up deleting code related to ""execute"" permissions. These permissions were unused. I had test failures related to creating these permissions, and rather than deleting the test and leaving the untested/broken code around, I thought it would be better to just remove it.",johnswanson,2024-02-26 18:30:43+00:00,['johnswanson'],2024-03-04 14:38:21+00:00,2024-03-01 23:22:38+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39170,"[('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 1964882673, 'issue_id': 2154840544, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2154187206,pull_request,closed,,Too eager unsaved changes warning when editing native questions,Closes #39001
Previously, for native questions, unsaved changes warning was shown when anything about the question changed.
Now, for native questions, unsaved changes warning will be shown only when the native query changed.
Nothing should change for GUI questions.
#### Warning is not shown when anything beside query is changed in a question
1. Create and save a native question with `SELECT 1;` query
3. Try to leave to another URL via navigation in sidebar
Expected result: unsaved changes warning **is not shown**
#### Warning is shown when query is changed
1. Create and save a native question with `SELECT 1;` query
3. Try to leave to another URL via navigation in sidebar
Expected result: unsaved changes warning **is shown**

2153987566,pull_request,closed,,Fix applying default values for a pinned sql question,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37831
For an SQL question, which is pinned to the collection, we need to run query applying the default parameters values.
To achieve this we pass an empty array as a value for `parameters` in `/api/card/:id/query` POST request
follow steps from e2e test or
- create a new sql question with parameter e.g. `select count(*) from people where {{date}}`
- add a filter mapping (field filter type) to the people -> birth date
- save a question and put it to the root collection
- pin this question (it should appear on the top of collection) - make sure the filter is applied
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2153925705,pull_request,closed,,[FIX: #39152] Public links refer to `null` when question is new,Closes #39152

When questions are new, they don't have an ID and aren't able to possess a public_uuid since they aren't saved. To solve this, we need to make sure that the user has saved the question before they try to create a public link for it.
2. See that, when trying to click the ""Share"" button in the bottom right corner, that a `First, save your question` modal pops up first.

2151774423,pull_request,closed,,Fixing bad pulses when bad params exist,Previously, when a dashboard parameter was removed that was depended upon by a subscription, the subscription went into a broken state that was unfixable (the removed param was still attached to the notification but not visible in the UI for editing). Rather than remove that parameter, which could potentially lead to data leaks, we just archive the pulse.

Now, when a dashboard is saved that would break a pulse/subscription, we archive the pulse and send an email the the dashboard and pulse creators to notify them that the pulse has been removed. The email also contains which params were removed as well as a list of who will no longer be receiving the messages.

One code consideration when writing the query logic to determine the blast radius of the bad pulse was whether to write a large join query then reorganize the results or do N+1 queries starting from the pulse id (The logic requires hitting all of pulse, pulse channel, pulse channel recipients, and user tables). I started with a full join query along the lines of what is shown below, but opted for the N+1 query as broken pulses should be a very rare occurrence so readability was preferred over performance.
The new behavior can be easily tested with this ns:
""Subscriptions will fail when parameter doesn't exists #30100

Fixes #30100",markbastian,2024-02-23 20:46:40+00:00,['markbastian'],2024-02-27 17:28:37+00:00,2024-02-27 17:28:20+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39136,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]","[{'comment_id': 1961980543, 'issue_id': 2151774423, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2151240529,pull_request,closed,,Ensure table-level perms are set correctly for API graph when incorporating sandboxes,When returning the API-style permissions graph to the FE, we need to add any sandboxes to the graph during post-processing, represented by `{:query :segmented, :read :all}` perms for the table.

In the process, we may need to add perms for all the other tables in the database or schema, if the permission was previously set at the database- or schema-level. Essentially we're ""breaking out"" perms set at the database- or schema-level to the table-level.

This code was working for perms set at the database-level, but not at the schema-level. I've fixed that in this PR and added a couple more tests.",noahmoss,2024-02-23 14:46:28+00:00,['noahmoss'],2024-03-06 21:01:00+00:00,2024-02-23 15:29:01+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39111,"[('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 1961463240, 'issue_id': 2151240529, 'author': 'noahmoss', 'body': '* **#39111** üëà * **#39087** * **#37473** : 26 other dependent PRs ([#37191](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37191) , [#37377](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37377) , [#37379](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/37379) and 23 others) * `master` This stack of pull requests is managed by Graphite. 2151236813,pull_request,closed,,Avoid add or removing keys when redacting :model/Database,"References https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/32822

This change updates the redaction logic for `:model/Database` so that we never outright remove a key (`:details`) or set the value to nil (`:settings`), but rather leave a sentinel value to indicate that we have redacted content. These strings are easily searchable to save time debugging where the redaction is happening.

In addition to never removing the keys, we now also avoid adding the keys back in, if for example they were never selected in the first place.",crisptrutski,2024-02-23 14:44:35+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2024-03-05 06:59:23+00:00,2024-03-05 06:59:23+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39109,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1961480579, 'issue_id': 2151236813, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2151145321,pull_request,closed,,Add test for POST /api/card/:id/query for parameters with defaults,This PR adds a test to clarify the BE behaviour of `POST /api/card/:id/query` when there are defaults applied to parameters. This behaviour was implemented in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/31891, but there were no tests specifically for this endpoint.

The test is mostly redundant because the same code path is used for other endpoints e.g. `POST /api/dashboard/:dashboard-id/card/:card-id/query`, which are tested and the code that does default parameter substitution is tested [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/31891/files#diff-ce58525a897b47b32a26ef9067c537a410de2e1e006ef9f6b1ec5443d1dd5bc1). But since it's pretty easy for the FE to use this endpoint incorrectly (see the confusion caused by https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37831), I thought it would be nice to add a test for this endpoint to document and lock down it's behaviour.",calherries,2024-02-23 13:56:05+00:00,['calherries'],2024-03-06 05:39:13+00:00,2024-03-06 05:39:00+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39106,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1977054118, 'issue_id': 2151145321, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': '@adam-james-v can you take another look?', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 4, 17, 1, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1980123814, 'issue_id': 2151145321, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@calherries Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 6, 5, 39, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]","calherries (Issue Creator) on (2024-03-04 17:01:18 UTC): @adam-james-v can you take another look?

2150976554,pull_request,closed,,goToNextStep in all thunks,This is a refactor on the redux issue described in the description of  [Add the step in the FE and pass the token to the setup api call](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38953)

It works by reverting the initSetup action and manually dispatching `goToNextStep` in all thunks that should advance the step. Thunks can access the global redux state so we don't have to worry about how to access the token-features anymore.

Force push your changes after cherry-picking.",metabase-bot[bot],2024-02-22 20:41:01+00:00,['ranquild'],2024-02-22 20:43:42+00:00,2024-02-22 20:43:39+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39075,"[('was-backported', 'apply this to PRs that are themselves backports')]",[],

Inspired by @kulyk's [prototype](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/35457), I used [@tanstack/react-virtual](https://github.com/TanStack/virtual) to make a generic list virtualizer that is easier to use than our current approach, and much easier to use for lists with variable-height items.
- simply virtualizes all of its children (which must be a list of react components) no matter what height they are.
- doesn't require any special measuring logic, it's all handled automatically ü™Ñ
As proof of concept, I implemented it in the archive app. While I was there I made a couple little design tweaks:
- Instead of setting the width of the content to 2/3, i gave the items a max-width of 40rem.
- Fixed the header and made the items scroll within their own container
- Removed the tiny bit of horizontal scroll on the page üî•
PS, this page is getting a total rework soon, so this is mostly proof of the usability of the virtualization library, which has a few other potential use cases.

2149796747,pull_request,closed,,Fix applying default values for a pinned question,"should fix #37831 in v48, but not in master
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/31891 changed the way of preparing parameters for BE - we started adding `{value: null}` if value wasn't presented.

> The point of the change is so we can differentiate between value: null (which means the no value should be applied even if it has a default) and the absence of a value key (which means we should apply the default value)
That comment made me think there could be a problem of handling cases like this on BE.
This PR adds a check whether it's collection preview or not, uses old way of calculating parameters (with value: null) for collection preview and the way introduced in #31891 for other cases.

Code in master has changed comparing to v48, so we need to provide a slightly different solution there",uladzimirdev,2024-02-22 19:31:30+00:00,['uladzimirdev'],2024-02-27 07:20:47+00:00,2024-02-27 07:20:46+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39072,"[('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 1960140174, 'issue_id': 2149796747, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2149740154,pull_request,closed,,Clean QueryBuilder props [PoC],This PR is just a PoC, and a preview of what we could (should?) do with the QueryBuilder.
It currently fetches way more data than it needs, and stores it in props . This leads to prop drilling that's hard to track.
We can identify where some of these props are used and move the fetching logic closer to the place it's needed.

By doing this examination, we might also find some completely unused props, like it happened [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39070/commits/ac20ea224d784ba48aac66204afd161b1189721a).",nemanjaglumac,2024-02-22 18:55:01+00:00,['nemanjaglumac'],2024-02-27 12:27:28+00:00,2024-02-27 12:27:17+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39070,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 1960079235, 'issue_id': 2149740154, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2149557189,pull_request,closed,,add support for networking errors in the token validation endpoint,Part of [[Epic] Add license activation in the initial setup](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38867)

Follow up to  [adds /api/setup/token-check and add license-token to POST /api/setup](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38858) to allow us to tell between invalid token and an error while trying to validate it.
This changes the backend to return `error_code: ""unable_to_validate""` when there's a network error or it's impossible to validate the token for other reasons.

The FE will display a custom error ([design on figma](https://www.figma.com/file/UFay4YjWyUMyl23T1cXzeC/Meet-first-time-embedders-at-the-door-with-a-dashboard?type=design&node-id=1757-9917&mode=design&t=LRD239xZS9jD37p7-4))

2148676298,pull_request,closed,,Hide dashboard actions on public/static embed dashboards,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34395
This PR hides the dashboard actions on public dashboard and static embeds.

Actually we already prevent those actions from running in dashboard in the first place, but this PR hides the actions so there's no confusion whatsoever that we don't allow actions to be executed on public and static embed dashboards.
2. Turn on the model actions setting on the database of the model in step 1)
3. Create an action of that model, you could use basic actions
4. Create a dashboard and add the action from step 3)
5. Share this dashboard via static embed or public link
6. Test that the action isn't visible in those cases
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2148575643,pull_request,closed,,Mitigate BE flakes caused by redshift-lbv-sync-error-test and redshift-types-test,This PR hopefully mitigates flakes on redshift in parallel tests.

I've seen a few flakes like [this](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/7991986113/job/21853226941?pr=39011#step:3:991) where the views / tables that are created in these tests are being picked up in other tests.

clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo: Failed to create :redshift 'checkins_interval_86400' test database: Failed to sync test database ""checkins_interval_86400"": Error in sync step Sync redshift Database 458 ''checkins_interval_86400'': Error in sync step Sync metadata for redshift Database 458 ''checkins_interval_86400'': ERROR: relation ""2024_02_22_f82431ee_73f5_4652_a3f6_02a8caad6c85_schema.late_binding_view"" does not exist

I suspect the problem is a race condition with parallel tests. This PR shortens the time it takes for the test to run, hopefully decreasing the likelihood that another parallel test will collide with it. 2148354028,pull_request,closed,,TableDefinition can define a custom PK,Currently if you define a dataset, all tables will be automatically created with an ID PK column.
This extends the tabledefinition so that you can specify a custom PK.
CREATE TABLE ""GROUP"" (""USER_UUID"" VARCHAR, ""ID"" BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT, PRIMARY KEY (""ID"")) ;
ALTER TABLE ""GROUP"" ADD CONSTRAINT ""fk_group_user_uuid"" FOREIGN KEY (""USER_UUID"") REFERENCES ""USER"" (""UUID"");

I also made `with-temp-test-data` able to take multiple tables, currently you can only create a dataset with a single table with it.",qnkhuat,2024-02-22 06:56:57+00:00,['qnkhuat'],2024-03-12 11:57:39+00:00,2024-03-12 08:45:41+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39038,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1991057156, 'issue_id': 2148354028, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@qnkhuat Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 12, 8, 45, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1991485620, 'issue_id': 2148354028, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': ""backport because I'll need this in a bugfix [PR](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38946) which I'll backport as well"", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 12, 11, 57, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]","github-actions[bot] on (2024-03-12 08:45:52 UTC): @qnkhuat Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_

This adds changes to support SAML2 SLO.

That includes sending the LogoutRequest, and accepting (and checking for success in) a LogoutResponse. The changes here build off my changes to [saml20-clj](https://github.com/metabase/saml20-clj) library, which add the SLO functionality there.
This also has some client-side code to handle the LogoutRequest redirection, and some tests to make sure the client gets correctly logged out on a successful LogoutResponse.
- [x] Add a route to initate SLO
- [x] Add a route to handle SLO response from IdP
- [x] Add a multimethod to handle the Single Log-Out (SLO) request, and have it fail for jwts.
- [x] use the proper saml20 library version (it is now using a git commit which hasn't at this time been merged)
- [x] Frontend should send the request to SLO _only when_ the user is a sso user and clicks logout (now we are sending this request no matter what).
- [x] Use `defenterprise` to access `sso-settings`, so that OSS doesn't blow up

hashing purposes. Before this change, given a `DatasetColumn` with a
frozen `field_ref` array, we would use it directly on the
`:metadata/column`, and `(hash column)` would try to mutate the frozen
This clones the array while converting the legacy column to MLv2 form,
so there's no issue with mutating it.

This [stack of pull requests](https://stacking.dev/?utm_source=stack-comment) is managed by [Graphite](https://app.graphite.dev/github/pr/metabase/metabase/39032?utm_source=stack-comment).

There was a layout issue where if a single log was taller than the contain for the logs it would make the container grow taller than what would be visible to the user. This affected the calculation of if the users was scrolled to the bottom and would disable the auto-follow feature.

The logs page was not preserving the user's scroll position in some cases when logs would be updated. Upon inspecting our internal MB instance, it appears this was due to request times taking longer than our poll duration, causing state updates to happen out of order. This would remove logs from the list and thus change the relative position of other logs.

In our internal MB instance, payload sizes were coming in ~200kb-800kb gziped / ~2MB-5MB uncompressed. Given we combine logs from more than one machine, the internal list of logs  combined to ~8MB. Since we are polling for new updates, we were taking our 8MB list of logs and trying to merge / 2-5MB on top of it. Between our merging implementation and usage of map/filter in our Logs component's render method, we were making several copies of this in memory every second. This results in large freezes in the UI. Here you can see setState alone taking almost 3 second to update:
1. For the auto-follow bug - it was a matter of using flex on the container component for force the content to shrink to the expected size.
2. User scroll position - I have updated the UI to skip polling for new logs if a previous request is still in flight.
b. updated mergeLogs function to be more performant (3 sorts w/ 3 copies reduced to 1, _.uniq was slow so replaced with hand rolled dedup implementation)
c. skip state merging / state updates if latest log in the most recent result is already present in our state
d. moment date formatting on large logs sets was slow, moving to dayjs and caching the last result reduced date significantly
- generate a large number of logs (for internal reviewers, you can borrow the response from stats)
- override your response body in dev tools with your large logs set ([how to do this in Chrome](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/overrides#set-up))
- your page should no longer freeze

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR",sloansparger,2024-02-21 21:54:03+00:00,['sloansparger'],2024-02-28 20:56:28+00:00,2024-02-28 20:56:14+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39031,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 1958516146, 'issue_id': 2147778404, 'author': 'paoliniluis', 'body': 'Can you also order them inverted? I want the new lines to appear on the top so I don‚Äôt need to scroll. Also a button to copy all the log lines would be awesome', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 22, 1, 50, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1960448242, 'issue_id': 2147778404, 'author': 'sloansparger', 'body': ""@paoliniluis I've fixed the auto-following feature so that should solve your issue with needing to scroll. If we reverse the order and prepend results we wouldn't have able to preserve the users scroll position as displaying new logs would change the position of all logs. It's not hard to do but our current copy button doesn't allow for this making it a bit more work."", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 22, 22, 37, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1960505768, 'issue_id': 2147778404, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

- Compare generated `app-main.css`, `styles.css`, `vendor.css` with ones from master branch.

2147131658,pull_request,closed,,Remove special describe-table-fks for redshift,This PR removes an implementation for `driver/describe-table-fks` for redshift.

We had a special case for redshift because apparently [`getImportedKeys`](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/sql/DatabaseMetaData.html#getImportedKeys-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-) didn't work 5 years ago when the driver was first implemented.

It's not required anymore because `getImportedKeys` has since been implemented, at least it I could trace it back to 2.1.0.11 in [this commit](https://github.com/aws/amazon-redshift-jdbc-driver/commit/7a1efb19412831bd0b9d20842d172df988664b8f).",calherries,2024-02-21 16:03:01+00:00,['calherries'],2024-02-23 15:28:47+00:00,2024-02-23 15:28:34+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39011,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 1957154095, 'issue_id': 2147131658, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

2147073091,pull_request,closed,,[serdes-v1] can now dump/load entity_id,Specifying `--include-entity-id` to a serdes v1 dump command will dump `entity_id` field into yamls. Load will use this field with no options though - but it'll check if it is present in data to use as one of markers that data has changed.
I decided not to add an option to load since right now it will use all data provided, just the markers that say ""data has changed"" were changed.

2146902096,pull_request,closed,,Fix can't select dashboard tabs in interactive embedding with parameter `header=false`,> [!note]
> To hide a question or dashboard‚Äôs title, additional info, and action buttons
Dashboard tabs is a very crucial part of the dashboard and should, in my opinion, never been hidden.
This PR fixes the problem by only hiding the other parts in the dashboard header except the tabs
**Note** Please also see the #39005 explaining the fix for the dashboard card not loading which is also fixed in this PR with a different approach.
1. Create a dashboard with multiple tabs
2. Visit the interactive embedding page where the iframe URL has this parameter `?header=false`
3. Visit the dashboard we created in 1)
4. See that the tabs are visible and you can select each tab.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2146824908,pull_request,closed,,Fix Interactive embedding dashboard with multiple tabs and parameter header=false will not load,> [!note]
> This fix is required in order to work on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38429
The problem came from the way we use `header=false`.
Here we see that we don't render `DashboardHeader` when `!isHeaderVisible` and this property is read from the `header` parameter.
which will initiate the Redux state `dashboard.selectedTabId`, without this value, the dashboard card will never load.
- Or run `e2e/test/scenarios/embedding/interactive-embedding.cy.spec.js`'s `should hide the dashboard with multiple tabs header by a param (metabase#39002)` test.
The dashboard card will never start loading
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2146799491,pull_request,closed,,Clear undo stack when first opening native editor,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/35344
When opening the native editor for a saved question, that question's query gets injected into the editor.
This creates an item on the undo stack, so a user could type <kbd>cmd</kbd> + <kbd>z</kbd> and undo to the empty state of the editor.
This PR removes the undo stack after first loading the editor to avoid this problem.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
6. Focus the editor and type <kbd>cmd</kbd> + <kbd>z</kbd> a couple of times. The query should not dissapear
7. Add some text to the query and verify that typing <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>z</kbd> _will_ undo your changes
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

- If the time is less than 1 second, the result is formatted as milliseconds (e.g. `123 ms`)
- If the time is at least 1 second, the result is formatted as seconds with 1 decimal place (e.g. `3.9 s`)

2146498399,pull_request,closed,,Native query tag editor field mapper: mimic Mantine,Following the https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38906, we're now updating the field mapper component to match new Mantine select styles. This PR only updates the way it looks from the outside, without touching the dropdown, which seems to be a larger undertaking due to the complexity of the `DataSelector` component.

I had to take a very cautious approach and be explicit in passing `isMantine` prop from `SchemaTableAndFieldDataSelector` since this set of components (`DatePicker`) is used in multiple places, and I don't want accidental changes.
# No changes in the model metadata sidebar

2146470544,pull_request,closed,,Use `getColumnKey` for `table.columns` viz setting,Migrates `table.columns` viz setting to use `getColumnKey` for matching and not MLv2 `findColumnIndexesFromLegacyRefs`. The latter has been proven to be unstable and I spent more than a month total figuring out issues with this function. `getColumnKey` is used for almost all other viz settings already.
Now we add an additional `key` property that is computed with `getColumnKey`:
- We re-create `key` based on `name` and `fieldRef` when it is empty.
- We set `key` in `column.js`, so all existing table settings would get this property when modifying the setting for the first time after upgrade.
- We still support missing `key` when matching columns with column settings for cases where table settings are accessed outside of the settings framework, like in `Question.ts`.
- Because we don't remove existing properties, downgrade should work as expected.

- To make it work correctly in all cases, we cannot rely on MLv2 to generate column names or `fieldRef`. This PR changes how `table.columns` setting is synced for MBQL queries to make it work like it does for native queries. Now, when the query results are available, we sync the setting using metadata from the QP and not MLv2. QP-based metadata is used for all viz settings, and it's great that we can make the QP the single source of truth here.
- One note is that syncing `graph.metrics` is still based on MLv2, and this is something we should refactor as well in the near future.
- Try hiding/showing columns in table viz setings
- Migrate `graph.metrics` to use QP results and not MLv2 for syncing
- I could force setting `key` for all updated questions so we might be able to get rid of legacy properties after several releases:

2145356483,pull_request,closed,,Persist last selected database in the native query editor for a user,## Info
This PR resolves #8780 by introducing a user-level setting for remembering the last used database in the native query.
- [x] Add new user-level setting to the backend
- [x] Wire native query editor to remember the last used database
- [x] Narrow the scope to just native questions and native models
- It should work for any authenticated user; frontend ensures that a user without sufficient native permissions is not even offered to select and persist the last used database
- The information about the last used database currently should not be included in the audit information

> The backend currently does have any additional checks to make sure the previously used database is still present. Frontend simply falls back to no database selected and prompts the user to select a new one.",nemanjaglumac,2024-02-20 21:55:02+00:00,['nemanjaglumac'],2024-02-28 13:40:03+00:00,2024-02-28 13:39:51+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38986,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 1959032340, 'issue_id': 2145356483, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

I think we should do in clojure in `last-used-database-id` getter and return `null` if the corresponding DB cannot be found (could be done in another PR) It seems that the FE already handles this. For example, I've had three databases, and persisted Postgres. Then removed postgres and started a new native query. The UI is asking me to choose a database again, which is the correct behavior, imo. ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/01936e9b-df53-4d46-8a5b-bce6bb45d49c)"", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 22, 13, 31, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1967435461, 'issue_id': 2145356483, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': ""Answering the bonus question here: > Would it be ok to define a custom :getter for this new defsetting value that would first check if the database still exists AND if the current user has necessary permissions to query it? Yes. We could also do the permission check in `GET /api/user/current` if it's a new column in the `core_user` table as I suggested above"", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 27, 19, 19, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1967442976, 'issue_id': 2145356483, 'author': 'nemanjaglumac', 'body': '> What happens when the last used database is deleted? Do we need a test for that? @calherries We already have it [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38986/files#diff-7140ba4e9ce90fa912c83d5042756afd2c4ee3fb0369b0e078683027ca7b2742R59). Frontend will prompt the user to select a new database.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 27, 19, 24, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1969009179, 'issue_id': 2145356483, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@nemanjaglumac Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 28, 13, 40, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]","replay-io[bot] on (2024-02-22 09:26:18 UTC):

nemanjaglumac (Issue Creator) on (2024-02-22 13:31:13 UTC): It seems that the FE already handles this. For example, I've had three databases, and persisted Postgres. Then removed postgres and started a new native query. The UI is asking me to choose a database again, which is the correct behavior, imo.
calherries on (2024-02-27 19:19:27 UTC): Answering the bonus question here:
Yes. We could also do the permission check in `GET /api/user/current` if it's a new column in the `core_user` table as I suggested above
